intro: Pelargonium angustum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved geranium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in coastal and mountainous regions. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and clusters of small, bright pink or red flowers. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms. Pelargonium angustum prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and containers.
